SOURCEDETAIL: MENA - refers to Middle East and Northern Africa. Data for the regional groupings established for the purposes of SDG reporting are not available for this indicator. ILO regional groupings are used instead.

MENA - refers to Middle East and Northern Africa. Data for the regional groupings established for the purposes of SDG reporting are not available for this indicator. ILO regional groupings are used instead.

MENA - refers to Middle East and Northern Africa. Data for the regional groupings established for the purposes of SDG reporting are not available for this indicator. ILO regional groupings are used instead.
FOOTNOTES: Children in hazardous work refer to children in any activity or occupation that, by its nature or type, has or leads to adverse effects on the their safety, health and moral development. It is a subcategory of child labour.

SOURCEDETAIL: MENA - refers to Middle East and Northern Africa. Data for the regional groupings established for the purposes of SDG reporting are not available for this indicator. ILO regional groupings are used instead.

MENA - refers to Middle East and Northern Africa. Data for the regional groupings established for the purposes of SDG reporting are not available for this indicator. ILO regional groupings are used instead.
FOOTNOTES: Children in labour refer to children who work that is prohibited by law and is a subset of children in employment.

SOURCEDETAIL: MENA - refers to Middle East and Northern Africa. Data for the regional groupings established for the purposes of SDG reporting are not available for this indicator. ILO regional groupings are used instead.
FOOTNOTES: Children in employment refer to all children aged 5-17 who work.
